newsitem.title: USA: Fed expected to add reserves via term system repos.
newsitem.headline: Fed expected to add reserves via term system repos.

text.p: The Federal Reserve could add temporary reserves to the banking system on Thursday through term system repurchase operations, analysts said.
Analysts said month-end and seasonal pressures were putting upward pressure on the rate.
Federal funds were trading at a slightly tight 5-9/16 percent, above the Fed's 5-1/2 percent target for the rate.
"There is a chance of system account RP," said Kevin Flanagan, first vice president and money market economist at Dean Witter Reynolds.
But Flanagan said the Fed might refrain from operations.

"They have $6.0 billion of (reserves from the) nine-day operation they did on Tuesday still on the books so that's taking care of the lion's share of the add need," he said. "There's not a great need for them to come in but with $1.0 billion to $2.0 billion of an add need remaining, they could show up."
(( -- Ellen Freilich, North American Treasury Desk 212-859-1679))
